OtherComments.Content: Stacking Diacritics This script inserts stacking diacritics for use with uppercase composites. They should be designed to fit the space above Capials and below the WinAscent.

To make the design stage easier, the Advance Width is initialy reset to zero. Display the capital E in the comparison toolbar and design the diacritics to align over that. Afterwards you can set a uniform advance width of 1024, which is used by many fonts, but it won't affect their horizontal position in composites.
When you have finished, move them all down by the same distance to align with lowercase accents.
